original_title: Sri Lanka rupee stronger against dollar, bond yields drop following credit rating upgrade
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s rupee opened at 302.10/20 to the US dollar on Monday, stronger from 302.45/50 on Friday, while bond yields were down following the credit rating upgrade, dealers said.
A bond maturing on 15.12.2029 was quoted at 9.48/52 percent, down from 9.50/54 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2030 was quoted at 9.66/70 percent, down from 9.70/75 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.03.2031 was quoted flat at 10.00/05 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.12.2032 was quoted at 10.35/45 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.11.2033 was quoted at 10.65/70 percent, from 10.65/75 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2034 was quoted at 10.75/80 percent.

The telegraphic transfer rates for the American dollar was 298.7500 buying, 305.7500 selling; the British pound was 401.2340 buying, and 412.5958 selling, and the euro was 348.2418 buying, 359.6050 selling.
The Colombo Stocks Exchange was trading in green; The ASPI was up 0.93 percent, or 196.48 points, at 21,281; the S&P SL20 was up 1.15 percent, or 68.82 points, at 6,064.
Rs. 38,000 million Treasury bills are to be issued through an auction on 24th September, the central bank said.
The central bank will announce its fifth monetary policy decision of the year on the same day (24) at 7.30 am.
Governor Nandalal Weerasinghe will hold a press conference at 11.30 am, which will be livestreamed on all major social media platforms. (Colombo/Sep22/2025)
